line.en: 'Are you saying that the Keifuu Academy students\nare going to contribute to the new windmill\nproject?'
After dinner, everybody gathered in the dining\nroom in the domitory, and they had an emergency\nSoaring Club meeting.

The main subjects were the breaking down of the
garage which Masatsugu heard about and the rumor
that Amane was coming back, which Ageha had heard
about.
'Starting a new windmill project?'
'Are they trying to build a new windmill on\nWindmill Hill?'
'I didn't know that.'
'They are trying to get students in our school to\njoin that project.'
'So, is Amane going to be a lecturer for that\ntraining?'
'I guess so.'
'How did you find out about it, Yoru?'
'Because the person who pays for that project is\nmy grandfather.'
'It's a good way to advertise the school. He told\nme to join the project, but I turned it down\nbecause I'm not interested in it.'
'I had no idea...'
'Why Amane?'
'Um, I don't know.'
'However, it seems to be true.'
Kotori, Ageha and I look at each other.
Amane is coming back... that's what we are\nthinking.
'Hey, can you ask Amane about being our\nsupervisor?'
'A lecturer is a teacher, isn't it? So Amane\nis...'
'She has a license and everything!'
Kotori and Ageha nodded at one another and begged\nme to agree.
'I think it's a good idea, but I'm not so sure\nthings will go over so easily.'
'It will be fine. Because Amane never says no.'
'She protected that garage by herself for a long\ntime.'
'It's settled then!'
If the Soaring Club comes back again, we can get\nthe garage and glider back.
Everything will be back.
'It's worth a try.'
Everybody nodded in agreement with Ageha.
I went back to my room after a bath and sat on\nthe bed.
Amane is coming back unexpectedly.
To Kazegaura.
It's abrupt and unexpected. Just like her\npersonality.
'I'll be able to see her again...'
...I like you, Amane.
...I just wanted you to know how I feel.
The love I had at that time, still remains in my\nheart.
The person I love.
But we haven't spoken since then.
Kotori has been sending us mail about the latest\nnews.
But we haven't done much, so there has been less\nand less mail.
Amane doesn't send us mail often.
She is a busy person, so she doesn't have time to\ntake care of us.
And,
I will leave the stuff behind that I can't take\nwith me because I don't need most of it...
She said, as she left most of the things in the\ngarage.
There were designs for a new glider which she had\nbeen working on for a long time, and the picture\nof the Morning Glory.
She left her memories.
Like she doesn't need them anymore.
And most of them are still in the garage.
They are sealed so that nobody could touch them\nagain.
Kotori said if we ask Amane to be our supervisor,\nshe will do it for sure. But I wonder if that's\ntrue...
She might have changed.
I grabbed the picture frame from the desk.
It's a picture that we took together after she\ncame back from the last flight.
There she is, in a group of happily smiling\npeople, the only one smiling awkwardly.
Maybe she's just not good at smiling. Or maybe\nthere was a reason that she couldn't smile from\nthe heart.
I laid down on the bed and looked at the ceiling.
'I felt a pain in my chest.'
I wonder if these feelings are different from\nsadness or pain. Could they come from special\nfeelings for her?
Amane is coming back.
Ever since I heard the news, my heart had been\npounding, although I had been trying to be calm.
The next day, I went to school by myself.
I overslept and was late finishing up my work in\nthe dormitory.
Kotori went to school first with Ageha.
'They are so heartless and cold,'
Complaining on the way, I walk along the street\nto school.
The weather was also very nice this morning.\nHowever, looking up at the sky makes me feel\nlost... because I still can't fly yet.
'Oh, an airplane.'
The airplane was flying, making a line in the\nblue sky.
It's weird that planes look like they're not\nmoving when seen from the ground, even though\nthey move very quickly.
There was a person looking up dazed at the sky\njust like me.
She was standing and looking up absentmindedly,\nnot noticing she is in the way.
'Um?'
'Hm?'
'Amane!?'
'Aoi?'
It was Amane.
I was surprised. And it seemed she was as well.
My eyes meet hers from a 10 meters' distance.
'Long time, no see.'
'Hi. Long time, no see.'
'Why are you here?'
'I have something to do at school.'
'I may be wrong but is it about becoming a\nlecturer?'
'You already know about that? I was called in for\npreparation.'
Ageha's story was true.
I'm not ready to meet her yet, so it feels quite\nawkward.
'S, so you are on your way to school, aren't you?\nCan I come with you?'
'Sure. No problem.'
We started walking together.
'(She hasn't changed much...)'
She is already an adult, so it's not like she\nwould change that much in just a year.
But I felt like she was calmer and somehow more\ngrown up.
'How have you been?'
'I'm good. How about you?'
'I'm great. I had three bowls of rice this\nmorning.'
'...You still eat a lot.'
'I have barely eaten for almost three days. It is\nnot really that much considering the timespan.'
She still concentrates so hard that she forgets\nto eat.
I am happy that she is still the same. But at the\nsame time, I am a little sad that she had been\nhaving a good time elsewhere.
'So, are you busy?'
'Yeah.'
She nods instantly.
That's right. She is not a student anymore.
I was bewildered momentarily and then opened my\nmouth.
'Do you have time today? Even a little?'
'I think I do.'
'We have something important to talk with you\nabout. Could you make time for us after school?'
She stared at me in a daze.
'Ok.'
After school...
Members of the Soaring Club were waiting for her\nin a vacant class room.
'She is late... Is she really coming?'
'She said she was...'
It's not impossible that she got too focused on\nsomething and forgot our promise.
'Ah... my heart is pounding.'
'She is the one they call the Legend of Keifuu\nAcademy, isn't she?'
'People say she is a genius.'
'Well, something like a genius...'
'She is sometimes an airhead and sometimes\nbrilliant. She is like a kid.'

Kotori speaks nostalgically about the good old
days, and from Asa's face, who hasn't met Amane,
it seemed as though she was wondering 'Just what
kind of person is this Amane?
Well, I guess in reality she is quite strange.
While we were talking, the door opened.
'Hey, sorry to make you wait.'
'Amane!?'
'Amane.'
Kotori and Ageha smile.
Asa and Eru stared at her meekly, obviously\nintrigued by this person they had only heard was\n'strange and brilliant.
'Ahahaha... Long time, no see, everybody. How are\nyou doing?'
'We've been good.'
Kotori seems very happy, like a faithful dog.
If she had a tail, it would definitely be\nwagging.
'You look well.'
'Yeah, I've been well but it has been a long time\nsince I have come to school, and meeting with the\nteachers was sort of exhausting.'
She rubs her shoulder like an old lady.
'So you are really going to be a teacher.'
'That's right. The next time you see me at\nschool, you should call me Mochizuki-sensei.'
She says it with confidence.
'You act big for just being Amane.'
'No, you act big.'
'But why are you going to become a teacher? I\nheard this project is about designing and\nbuilding a new windmill.'
'I designed that windmill.'
As she says it as if it is nothing, expressions\nof amazement and surprise spread over everyone's\nfaces.
'I don't understand but that sounds great. Hey\nAsa, isn't she great?'
'Yeah. I think so.'
'I designed that windmill using what I learned\nmaking gliders...'
'Before I realized it, it had been arranged that\nI make the windmill, after the designs were\ndiscovered by my colleagues.'
'I have more work to do because of this.'
She says it like she is really in trouble.
It seems like she isn't happy about doing this\nwork.
But because of this we could meet up with her\nagain.
'By the way, what did you want to talk to me\nabout?'
Everybody had been happy but the atmosphere got\nserious quickly.
'To be honest, Amane...'
Kotori explained about our current Soaring Club\nsituation.
And what has happened since she left.
About how after that scandal where we barricaded\nourselves, our club changed to a society, and\nabout our current activity.
To be honest, I felt bad that we had to tell her\nabout it.
She was listening to us without anger or sadness.
'But new members joined us!'
'Asa and Yoru. Yoru is like a bonus prize. But\nshe has helped us a lot.'
'Yeah?'
She stares at Asa and Yoru like twins are\nsomething new to her.
'I'm Asa Kazato.'
'I'm her sister, Yoru.'
'I'm Amane Mochizuki. Nice to meet you.'
'I've heard about you a lot from Kotori! You are\na legend!'
Asa says it looking at her like she was a\ncelebrity.
'Legend...?'
She wonders out loud.
She seems like she is aware that she left a\nlegacy.
'Is that all you wanted to tell me about?'
'Actually, they are thinking of demolishing the\ngarage again.'
'And that's not the end of the story. They are\ntrying to donate our glider to the city museum.'
'We want to stop them. To do so... we need them\nto approve our society as a club.'
'...but there is no supervisor for our club.'
'So, please Amane, become our supervisor!'
When Kotori begged, Amane said 'umm...' and\nstarted thinking.
She looks at our faces one by one.
'What are you gonna do after you stop them?'
'What? Uhm...'
'That garage is... isn't that garage our... isn't\nit an important place where Amane and the rest of\nus spent our time together?'
She looks at us as if she is worried.
I remembered when she left here without taking\nany of the memorabilia from the garage.
'Do you want them to approve our club because you\nwant to protect the garage?'
'No. That's one of the reasons though.'
'We have a goal. That goal is flying the Morning\nGlory that we couldn't fly before.'
'We've been preparing for it.'
'Preparing?'
'We analyzed the drawing you left, and simulated\nthe production process.'
'We studied a lot about gliders so that we could\nmake them even if you weren't here.'
'Then, we found out it's possible to improve the\nairframe.'
'We decided to start working on the flight plan\nagain.'
'It's not just the memories we want to\nprotect...'
'We want to protect the dream we had together!'
Kotori's eyes were filled with tears.
Amane's eyes were wet, but pure and serious and\nshe looked like she might change her mind.
She must have the same thoughts.
But...
'You should give up...'
She said it weakly.
'Why, Amane?'
'The Morning Glory will never come back.'
She says so to persuade us not to do it.
'Last year, the clouds appeared in the sky over\nKazegaura. It was the first time in 26 years.'
'Do you think that kind of rare phenomenon\nhappens every year?'
'We don't know! Nobody knows why it happens yet.'
'So I still believe it will appear again!'
Amane looked at Kotori with incredible sadness in\nher eyes.
But Kotori stared back at her without flinching
'...Sorry, I can't do it.'
'I owe you a lot and I want to help you...'
'...Well, you are very busy, aren't you?'
Ageha said it because she probably wanted Amane\nto give a good excuse that she can't do it.
But she...
'I can't have the same dream as you anymore.'
She said the last thing that we wanted to hear.
With that, the conversation was over.
'Quack?'
'Ah, here you are.'
In the garden of the Flying Fish Manor, Kotori\nwas spacing out with Hat on her lap.
'You calmed down?'
Kotori says nothing but that means 'yes.
After Amane said those hopeless words to Kotori,\nshe went back to the dormitory and cried.
Because of her pride, she held her tears until\nshe got home.
But she cried really hard as soon as she shut the\ndoor and she let out a shockingly loud wail that\nreached all the way outside.
'I never thought Amane was that kind of person.'
She says it as if to say she'd misjudged Amane's\ncharacter.
'...She has her reasons, I think.'
It's probably not a grown-up situation.
If it were, she wouldn't reject us like that. She\nwould have different reasons.
'She could have just said that she was busy
The sad eyes Amane looked at Kotori with... I\nhave never seen her eyes like that.
'She might have changed.'
'I'm not sure. But I don't think she has changed\ncompletely.'
'Why?'
'When you said you want to protect the dream we\nhad together, she looked like she might be\nswayed.'
It might be my mistake.
Or rather, I wanted to think like that, so it\ncropped up in my thoughts.
But to me, she looked like she could sway.
'...I told you that I saw her at the garage on\nthe last day of summer break.'
'Hm? Oh, yeah.'
The day when she left.
She tried to leave without saying good-bye.
'On that day, I confessed to her.'
'What...?'
'I told her that I loved her.'
'I didn't know that.'
'You loved Amane. Huh.'
'Yeah.'

I'm not sure. But I don't think she has changed
completely. I've never changed my mind even
though I couldn't see her. And when I met her
today, I realized I still love her.
'She didn't feel the same way though.'
'So, what happened today...'
'Yeah, I was shocked.'
I say it as if we were talking about someone\nelse.
'...Sorry I cried so much.'
'Ah... I'm no good... I can't see past my own\nnose.'
'That's not a problem. I feel better because you\ncried.'
'So, you loved her...'
'...But why did you tell me?'
'Maybe I feel lonely, so I wanted someone to\nknow.'
The things that happened today were probably more\nshocking than I was even aware of.
'Ehehehe... I'm kinda happy. It's like a\nfriendship.'
When I saw Kotori's smile, I felt much better.
'Last year, when we flew the morning glory, she\nsaid something.'
'She said, 'This is good-bye!''
Looking at the disappearing passage of clouds\nfrom the cockpit, she seemed sad but broke\nthrough it and whispered.
'The dreams of the glider and Isuka became a\nmemory of the past for her.'
'And now we too only exist in that memory.'
Hat was looking up at Kotori and was murmuring\nsadly on her lap.
A few days after Amane turned down being our\nsupervisor...
The day the garage was to be demolished and the\nglider was going to be donated was approaching.
After school, we gathered in the classroom,\nwaiting for people who didn't have clubs.
'We have to do it.'
'Yeah... you're right.'
'Forget about the garage for now, we have to get\nback our glider.'
'Aoi? What's wrong? You're so quiet.'
'I was just thinking... there must be another\nway.'
'If there were we wouldn't be talking like this.\nWe're already out of time.'
'Yeah... but we would be punished. If there were\nsomething we could do...'
I looked at Kotori.
She realizes why I was looking at her like that\nand she starts talking.
'Don't worry about me.'
'But this time, you'll be...'
She might be kicked out of the school.
Kotori's family is complicated.
'If we don't do something, our glider will be\ntaken away.'
'...But I don't want to lose you because of\nthis.'
'It's not going to happen. I'll never let them do\nit. So...'
'We can make a new glider from scratch. And we\nmight even find a place for our club, too.'
'Yeah...'
'What are we talking about? I don't like it.'
'That glider... those wings...'
'Oh, sorry. Please don't cry.'
'I'm not crying...'
'Anyway, we'll investigate and make it work.'
We can't afford to leave any evidence. That way\nwe can play dumb if they find out.
I was walking around the school to look for a way\nto carry out the glider.
It's easy to sneak in if we have a key because\nthe garage is not in plain sight.
The problem is carrying out that big glider\nwithout being seen.
'We should open the lock during the day and carry\nit out at night.'
The garage is outside of the school building and\nnot being used.
Security might not be tight because there is no\nimportant stuff in there.
How can we carry a glider that big and heavy?
This time, I can't ask An-chan for help...
'Aoi?'
'Huh? Oh, Amane.'
Amane came out of the building.
The students who know Amane look at her in\nsurprise.
'Did you have another meeting?'
'Yeah. They suggested using a hall because more\ncandidates will come than we expected.'
'But I have never been a teacher, so I just told\nthem I don't want to do it in a big hall.'
'That sounds nice, I wish I could try out your\nclass.'
'You are always welcome. I'm going to go see the\nplace where new windmill is to be built. Do you\nwant to come with me?'
'Are you sure?'
'Yes, of course.'
She said so and started walking ahead of me.
'Is it going to be built here?'
I gazed blankly at the hill over which the wind\nblew.
'Some sites have been proposed. We are still\nthinking about which one is best.'
She looks at the hill in earnest.
A lot of windmills are in motion, being spun by\nthe wind from the lake.
'Are you going to work on one until it is\nfinished like these?'
'Hm? No, I only designed the windmill. Another\nperson is in charge of project.'
Climbing the hill, she says 'But,' and cuts\nherself off.
'I think I may be able to put in suggestions.'
'You work really hard.'
'Do I?'
I should do what I can, even if it's not my job.
She doesn't brag or hate doing it.
'I think you're a hard worker, Aoi.'
'...I'm just a backseat driver.'
'Hee hee. Alright.'
She laughed happily.
My heart pounds when I see her laugh.
I walked around the windmill hill with her for a\nwhile.
She looked for good places other than the ones\nthat were already proposed as sites.
'Ok. That's it.'
She closed her notebook after she finished\nwriting.
'Did you learn what you needed?'
'...Um, maybe.'
She answered unclearly, then she looked around\nthe hill.
We are in the middle of the slope.
'I like it here... the wind feels great...'
she says, half-closing her eyes as she feels the\nbreeze.
'...I haven't been here since that day.'
'That day?'
She looks at me puzzled.
'The day you all had a farewell party for me.'
'Ahh.'
It's not like I had forgotten the day she was\ntalking about, but 'that day' didn't bring it to\nmind.
I took her outside while everybody was preparing\nfor the party because we wanted to surprise her.
I took her here to save some time.
'You still remember.'
'Yeah, I do.'
Enjoying the view, she speaks very casually.
My heart pounded at her words again.
And our kiss that day...
'It never changes here. Time passes very slowly.'
She says so to herself and opens her arms to feel\nthe wind.
'...Did you change?'
I asked her without thinking.
'Hm?'
'Your mind... did you change your mind?'
'...Are you talking about the other day?'
I nod.
'Maybe. I'm not a student anymore.'
'So you changed because you are not a student\nanymore. Is that it?'
'Yes, that's what it is.'
I'm a student now and have a few more years until\nI graduate.
I might even transfer to college.
I couldn't imagine myself not being a student.
'To be honest, I'm not sure.'
'But I've caused a lot of trouble, so I feel like\nI need to grow up as soon as possible.'
She is much older but she still acts like a\nkid... that's why I loved her.
Am I selfish to think I don't want her to change?
I know that but I feel impatient.
'I owe you guys a lot, so if I can I want to pay\nyou back.'
'But... I think it's not right to fly that glider\nagain.'
'You can have another dream. This time it just\nhappened to be that glider.'
I agree.
But some part of me is saying 'no!
The garage and glider are very important to us.
The memories of spending time with Amane\nMochizuki who I love... those are important.
'Did you turn down that offer because you think\nwe are wrong?'
'...I guess so.'
She says it apologetically.
I understand what she is saying.
It is a normal thing for adults to say.
But it made me very angry.
Because Amane Mochizuki gave such an obvious,\nnormal, adult opinion.
'I don't know what is right or what is wrong...'
'I just don't want people to decide what is right\nfor me.'
'Aoi?'
'When I flew with you, my heart pounded. When we\nwere making the glider together, I was happy.'
'I could keep it up after the club is long gone\nbecause it was fun to aim for the sky together.'
'...Did you change? Don't you feel the same way?'
Were we wrong back then?
The dream I had with her...
The emotions I had when we flew for the first\ntime...
The mortification I felt when I couldn't succeed.
'I want to take you to the place that we couldn't\nreach that day.'
'Am I wrong to think like that?'
I asked her like I was begging.
She looked away.
'That is...'
She didn't say anything after that.
'Welcome back.'
'Yeah, hey.'
'Huh? What's wrong? You seem upset.'
'It's nothing.'
After that, I saw her off at the bus stop and\ncame home.
It was awkward because we made almost no\nconversation.
I was very upset.

Because she put on an act like an adult, she
didn't do anything wrong, but I took it out on
her like she did. And she didn't answer my
question.
I was upset at so many things.
'Hey, about the plan...'
'We don't have time. We should carry it out\ntomorrow.'
'Alright. I'll tell Ageha.'
The glider is very important to us even if it's\njust a part of the past for her.
After I said good-bye to Aoi, I didn't take the\nbus. I headed to the runway without even\nrealizing it.
Because nobody had used it in a while, it was\ncovered with grass.
I remember being drenched with sweat weeding the\ngrass.
'That was hard.'
If we don't do it, long grass would get stuck in\nthe wheels.
So it was very important to flying.
'Huh? Oh, it's you, Amane. Hey.'
'Hm?'
Tatsuya was waving at me beside the winch.
I wanted to be alone, so I hesitate to go over\nthere. But I start walking to him anyway.
'What are you doing here?'
'Just walking.'
'How about you, Tatsuya?'
'I'm here for maintenance.'
As he says that he takes the cover off the winch.
'Are you taking care of it?'
'They do it themselves. But I worry, so I come\nhere sometimes.'
'Oh, okay.'
'What's up? You look sad.'
'Yeah...'
I look down and he looks at me anxiously.
'I heard you turned down being a supervisor.''
'How did you know?'
'Ageha told me. She was pretty down.'
'Oh.'
So she gets the blues sometimes.
I got the impression that she is the calmest\nperson of them all.
'Why didn't you take it?'
'I grew up. I can't be like a student again.'
'Grew up? Does it change instantly like that?'
'I have to change sometime.'
Tatsuya got out of the school much earlier than\nme and became an adult.
'I guess.'
He keeps at his maintenance work as he talks.
'If you are an adult in society, you have to have\nresponsibility.'
'You have to be responsible for what you do.'
'Yeah...'
'But I've barely seen any adults who take\nresponsibility like that.'
'Are you so sure?'
'Take me, for example. I'm trying to act like a\nchild still, being nosy like this.'
'You are helping them because you are close to\nAoi, aren't you?'
'That's one of the reasons but that's not all of\nit.'
'I just love watching them fly.'
'You like them flying?'
Tatsuya nods.
'If I can be a little selfish about it, I entrust\nmy dream to them.'
'I want them to do what we couldn't.'
Tatsuya works carefully on the winch while he\ntalks.
And I look over him as he does.
'You haven't flown once all year.'
'Yeah, but it needs to be maintained.'
The old winch was in good shape.
Even though it hasn't been used.
...Ready to fly anytime.
Their maintenance hasn't been neglected.
Tatsuya looks at me as I am silent.
'When you left a year ago, they were very sad.'
'You didn't say good-bye to them, did you?'
'No, I didn't...'
It was too hard for me to say good-bye.
I knew I wouldn't want to leave anymore.
So I wanted to leave without saying good-bye to\nanybody...
(I love you.)
(I just wanted you to know how I feel.)
'What's the matter?'
'N, nothing.'
I suddenly feel hot, so I fan myself.
'You probably understand.'
'Hm?'
'The feeling of losing someone very important to\nyou.'
'Because you lost Isuka.'
'Even having their garage and glider taken away,\nthose kids aren't discouraged. They even came by\ntoday.'
'Hee hee. They are just like somebody I know.'
Is that someone me?
'I'm telling you, they are very serious about\nthis stuff.'
'Aoi got a pilot's license. Ageha and Habane work\nin my factory.'
'Work?'
'They are learning FRP and other process\ntechnologies. They get a little money too.'
'They even want to get materials for their glider\ninstead of cash.'
'Do they really?'
I put too much strain on them...
'You were just thinking that it's your fault,\nweren't you?'
'Uh, no.'
'I can see it on your face.' Tatsuya laughed.
'They might do it for you. But they don't do it\nbecause of you.'
'What do you mean?'
'They're doing it for themselves.'
'It's fun to make a glider and fly. And they love\nyou for giving them that dream.'
'So it's for me, but it's not my fault...'
'You don't have to force yourself to grow up.\nYou'll grow up eventually.'
'But you will never be able to go back. So I\nthink you should do whatever you can now.'
'You think too hard.'
Saying that, he closed the winch cover.
It seems he finished the maintenance.
'I'm going home. Do you want me to take you to\nthe station?'
'No, that's ok. I want to be here a while\nlonger.'
'Alright. See you.'
'Thanks, Tatsuya.'
He smiled at me and left with his tools.
I was the only one who was on the runway again.
Suddenly sadness wells up in me.
...You'd probably understand, wouldn't you? The\nfeeling of losing someone very important to you.
...Because you lost Isuka.
'...I hadn't been here since that day.'
I murmur, and I imagine a glider being pulled by\na winch and then lifting off from the runway in\nthe evening sun.
My first test flight here.
It was also the first day for Isuka to fly.
The wings we made were terrible. So the test\nfailed.
But it remains in my mind it because it was so\nmuch fun.
The surprise I had when the wings we made flew...
'That feeling was strange... It's normal for a\nglider to fly.'
It's a machine made for flying.
Even if it flew, that only means it was correctly\nassembled.
But my heart pounded.
'I was excited.'
Speaking of which, I feel like my first test\nflight with Aoi was the same.
On that day, I had to be the pilot, so I was more\nscared than I was excited.
But...
I still don't think it's the right decision to be\nthe Soaring Club's supervisor.
I will cause trouble again.
...I don't want people to decide what is best for\nme.
I just remembered what Aoi said.
And I also remember what that other person said.
When was it...?
'I don't think there is right or wrong.'

'You are the only one who can decide what is
right for you. Don't you think so? Because there
are a lot of things that are wrong for other
people.'
'So I don't want people to decide what is right\nfor me.'
'If you are confused, you should listen to\nyourself. There you can find your right choice.'
'...That's right. Isuka said it.'
When I was confused, Isuka told me that laughing.
I remember I was very surprised at that time.
Because I thought there is the only one right\nanswer.
But Isuka laughed at me and said there are as\nmany answers as there are heads to think of them.
I'd never come up with something like that. I\nthought Isuka was a genius.
I touched my heart and I listened to it.
But I heard somebody else, not me.
...It's not only the memories we want to protect.\nWe want to protect the dream we had together!
...I want to take you to the place that we\ncouldn't reach that day. Is it wrong to think\nlike that...?
My heart told me what they said.
The next day, we carried out the plan to get the\nglider back after school.
'First, we'll get the key for the garage and open\nit.'
'Then we'll return the key and go back at night.'
'We need to get a bicycle-drawn cart to carry it.\nIt's too big and heavy to carry by hand.'
'Um... but we still don't have enough people.'
'...I can't be of much use.'
'Actually, you really don't have to do anything.'
'How come?'
'In case, they find out.'
'He's right. If they find out, we'll say Aoi and\nI did it all.'
'Why? I don't want to be an outcast.'
'Your situation is different from ours.'
'Right. I don't want you to have to leave even if\nit's to get the glider back.'
'First, we need to get the key. I heard Tobioka\nis taking care of it.'
'That's a tough one.'
'What are you doing? What are you talking about?'
Oops!
She spoke so suddenly it froze me in place like I\nhad looked Medusa in the eyes.
'...That kinda hurts my feelings if it scares you\nthat much.'
'Ah, Akari! We are not planning to do anything\nbad at all!'
'R, right. You shouldn't say such blatentely\ndisreputable things if you don't want to hear me\ncomplain.'
'I just said, 'What are you talking about?' I\nwonder if you guys are planning something bad.'
'N, nothing. They are just dumb.'
Everybody tries frantically to smile deceptively.
She looks at us suspiciously and sighs.
'Nevermind. Anyway, congratulations to everyone\nin the Soaring Club.'
'What?'
'Huh? Haven't you heard yet?'
We couldn't understand what she was talking about\nand looked at each other.
'The Soaring club was officially reinstated.'
'What? Why?'
'Mochizuki came to the teacher's room and offered\nto be the supervisor.'
'What?!'
'Amane?'
We looked at her beautiful face in surprise.
Akari flinches as if frightened by how we looked\nat her.
'...A few teachers didn't agree but Mochizuki\nsaid it like this.'
'... I use the knowledge that I got from making\ngliders to make the concept work for the new\nwindmill.'
'If you can't accept that, I can't accept this\njob.'
'Did she really say it like that?'
Amane said something strong like that?
'They don't want that so they accepted\nimmediately.'
'Except for a few, our teachers have a soft spot\nfor her.'

They accepted her repeating courses for a long
time. It's probably just some kind of adult
consideration, rather than having any hope for
her.
But...
'Amane said it...'
'Hey, it's too early to cry.'
'Here's the key to the garage. I got it for you.'
Kotori took the key very carefully like she was\ntrying not to spill even a drop of a very\nimportant liquid.
'Where is Amane now?'
'I don't know. Seems like she went home.'
She had just left the school and we chased after\nher.
'Make haste, Aoi!'
'Alright!'
I push Kotori's wheel chair as I run.
And, over there!
'Oh!'
Tobioka was just walking from the gate.
'Huh? ...Oh, you kids.'
As soon as he recognizes us, he starts staring at\nus.
We pass him like we don't see him.
'See ya, teach.'
'See ya.'
'I don't recognize your club, you know.'
When we passed him, we heard what he said.
He said it with a red face.
Kotori said something to him.
'Bleeegh!'
We are in a hurry.
We have something more important to do than make\nsarcastic remarks at him.
So Kotori's zinger was good enough.
Wind blows over the runaway...
The wind from the lake blows the summer grass on\nthe runway.
It seems like time has been stopped for the past\nyear.
But there is a reason I felt that way.
It appears to be the same but it has changed.
The grass has grown and bugs live there.
The iron rusts and rots, but Tatsuya takes care\nof it.
Our world is still gray, like it's rotten.
But the sky is blue.
'I enjoyed it...'
I was convinced that I continued doing it to keep\nIsuka's promise...
But I started enjoying making gliders with Aoi,\nKotori and Ageha.
No, that's not it.
Since Isuka was here.
Fun... I'd never felt that way until I met Isuka.
A glider flying in the sky...
It's really obvious, but why is it so fun?
'...I'm still not good at... 'just enjoying\nthings.''
'That's just silly.'
While murmuring to myself, I heard a voice.
'There she is! Hey, Amane!!'
'Amane!!'
'Amaneee!!'
I saw Kotori, Ageha and Aoi running towards me.
At that moment, not only the sky, but the whole\nworld started shining.
My heart is pounding and I feel very excited.
These are my expectations for the future...
And my feelings of nostalgia.
I started running.
'Hey guys!'
'*falls down*'
'She fell down!'
'Are you ok?'
'Amaneee!!'
Falling down is not so bad.
Because it reminds me of where I am. Although it\ndoes hurt a little.
And...
I was embarrassed because I had everyone worrying\nabout me.
